dialogues.text: Is it though...? Mitch bumps fists with smiling co-workers... Dave watches Sabrina CHEER after a base hit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so strange, when the change-up happened, we were so focussed on switching back into our bodies that we didn't even consider that this might be exactly what we both needed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're fucking morons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, well, see ya, Dave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Mitch...
They both hang up, surprised smiles on their faces...

dialogues.speaker: A DEAFENING THUNDER-CLAP
dialogues.text: RAIN blankets Los Angeles that night. It's an epic storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The private back room of this upscale Beverly Hills eater filled with the esteemed PARTNERS of Steel, Kuhbach, McCl as well as Mitch, Jamie, and little Cara. Everyone's dres to the nines and enjoying fabulously overpriced food and drink. Then Flemming stands and DINGS his wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III
dialogues.text: Good evening, one and all! The room quiets as a PROJECTION SCREEN lowers behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are gathered here tonight to celebrate the newest partner in our esteemed firm. For those of you who haven't had the pleasure of working with this brilliant young man, we've prepared this short, mildly embarrassing presentation to introduce him. Please, enjoy... Mitch looks at Jamie, who smiles conspiratorially. Behind table, Gladys turns on a projector. Some Dido song plays on the SCREEN, we start to see PHOTOS from Dave's life...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David Andrew Lockwood was born on February 1st, 1974, in Palmdale... SHOTS of Dave as a baby appear. Everyone AWWW's. Jamie ta Mitch's hand...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dave was a sweet, diligent, hard- working little boy... A SHOT of boyhood Dave in a very dorky 70's Little League outfit flashes onto the screen...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In high school, Dave belonged to over 17 clubs and teams, and graduated first in his class...

SHOTS play of Dave in 80's high school apparel, arguing f the debate team, wearing a goofy beret at French Club, et Everyone LAUGHS. Jamie smiles at Mitch, only he looks a little troubled: this is not my life...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After winning a full scholarship to Princeton, Dave amazingly graduated in just three years... A SHOT of college-age Dave getting his diploma appears...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And, after graduating from Yale Law School with high honors, Dave clerked for Justice Souter on the United States Supreme Court... A SHOT of young Dave talking with Justice Souter plays... Around the table, the partners MURMUR, impressed. Mitch g increasingly uncomfortable, shifting in his seat...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shortly after, Dave returned west to marry his lifelong best friend, Jamie Anne Johnson... SHOTS roll of Dave and Jamie on their wedding day, laughi Jamie squeezes Mitch's hand, a happy mist in her eyes. Mi frowns: this is not my wife...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cara came along first, followed by the twins, Peter and Sarah... SHOTS of Dave, wearing scrubs, happily holding his variou newborn babies in the hospital flash onto the screen... Cara leans over to Mitch and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Daddy, it's you and me! Mitch forces a tight smile, right...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III
dialogues.text: And somewhere along the way, we were lucky enough to find him...
SHOTS roll of Dave as a lawyer, swearing in at the Bar, arguing in court, and, finally, celebrating today's victo The image fades as the lights in the room slowly rise...

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Industrious. Ambitious. Honorable. They were true of him then, they are even more true of him now. It is my distinct honor to introduce our newest partner, David Lockwood. The room breaks into heartfelt APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: HUZZAH
dialogues.text: Mitch squirms, hating this... Jamie leans over to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so proud of you, baby. You worked so hard for this... Mitch winces, knowing just how wrong she is. All around h the partners stand, APPLAUDING. Mitch stands, a bit dizzy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I'm sorry...I just... He hurries off towards the bathroom. Everyone looks confu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours down outside. Then Dave and Sabrina, soaking w in their Dodgers gear, run into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I'm soaking-- (taking in barren apartment) Wait, are you a single guy? Dave laughs and throws her a towel from the bathroom. She starts drying her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a beer and some dry clothes. When Dave passes her, though, she stops him, and starts kissing him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe...mmm...maybe just a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch stands in the restaurant's upscale men's room, star at himself in the mirror, lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing...? This isn't my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Lockwood... He spins to see Gladys in the doorway, vamping, sexy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Gladys, not now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching, coy) I'm not wearing any bloomers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we talked about not using

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! She throws him against the bathroom wall and starts aggressively undressing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's bothering you, Mr. Lockwood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Gladys, I love bathroom sex as much as the next guy, but-- She SPITS in his face, crazy-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping face, a bit scared) O-Okay? Well, I guess what's bothering me is...I didn't earn any of this, you know? Gladys rips open his shirt and starts licking his chest downward until she disappears OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know what you're thinking: Mitch, not earning things never used to bother you, why does it bother you now? And the answer is: maybe I'm growing up. We hear the sound of his pants UNZIPPING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, sure, I closed the deal today, and that felt good, but I didn't put in all the years of hard work that got Dave to this point, you know? Plus, those aren't my adorable kids, that's not my beautiful wife, you're not even my freaky deaky old lady secretary. I want to earn this stuff-- Just then FLEMMING STEEL III BLOWS IN -- and stops cold:

dialogues.speaker: GOOD GOD MAN
dialogues.text: GO WIDE to see that Gladys is in the Reverse Wheelbarrow position, her palms on the bathroom floor, her feet again the bathroom wall, with Mitch between her legs, his pants around his ankles. Mitch sees his boss -- and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: THE REVERSE WHEELBARROW
dialogues.text: Mitch and Gladys disengage and straighten themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, it's not my fault--!

dialogues.speaker: FLEMMING STEEL III
dialogues.text: Have you forgotten everything you learned in law school?! You can't screw a direct hire! How can we possibly make you a partner now?! You're completely exposed--! We hear a GASP from the doorway. Everyone turns to see Ja -- she's heard the whole thing. Mitch quickly zips his pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might be having an affair... but not with Gladys:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Age-ist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie, you gotta believe me, this woman is a predator--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? No. I can't do this anymore. I want you out of the house by the time the kids wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie--! Too late. She runs off, choking back tears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fastening his belt, Mitch sprints out of the restaurant, desperate -- but Jamie is already SQUEALING away in her c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK! Fuck... He stands in the rain, overcome with self-loathing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, in dry clothes, sits on his couch, happily drinking beer and watching SportsCenter. He calls into the bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find anything that fits? Then Sabrina appears in the doorway, wearing one of his o tee shirts-and panties.. .and nothing else... she's unrea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all I could find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. As she bends over to dim the lamp, her tee shirt rides up exposing her perfectly tan, arched back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hyperventilating, to himself) Please don't come, please don't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he stops short. On Sabrina's lower back is a cut tramp stamp tattoo of a BUTTERFLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God: a Many-Spotted Skipperlinq... And everything comes rushing back. His family. His wife. entire life. He looks overcome with emotion... Sabrina notices as she slides onto the couch with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay, baby...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I just... Dave rubs his temples, overwhelmed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not--? Just then the door flies open and

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE STORMS INSIDE
dialogues.text: soaking wet, hysterical, her mascara running all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is cheating on me! Dave quickly covers his hard-on with a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not! I'm so not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you lie to me, Mitch?! We've known each other for--! Then Jamie sees scantily-clad Sabrina and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this chick?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering, pointing) Umm...she's...uh...this just got very complicated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- I'm Jamie, the wife of one of Mitch's friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Jamie Lockwood? Dave's wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the prick?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we work together. He cheated on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, with his secretary, Gladys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the women in the office, he picked her?! Slightly awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Jamie, I didn't know about Gladys, I swear. But I'm sure she means absolutely nothing to Dave--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No more excuses! The next time you see my asshole husband tell him that I will never. Ever. Take him back, you got that?! Dave nods quickly, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabrina! It was nice to meet you!
Barely holding it together, Jamie wheels and exits, SLAMM the door behind her. Dave just stands there, holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch sadly packs children's snacks and Capri Sun's into duffel bag in the darkened kitchen, hating himself. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? Mitch turns to see Cara, small and fragile in the doorway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, angel, it's nothing. I'm just going away for a little while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... confusing grown-up stuff--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-Okay? Well. I'm leaving because I'm a fuck up. Do you know what a fuck up is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Uncle Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Right. Well, I thought this time was different, you know? I thought I actually did something right for once. But no, I'm still the same old fuck up I've always been. Only this time I really fucking fucked up, because I fucked up my life and my best friend's life... Mitch zips up his bag, full of regret -- and finds Cara hugging his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're a fuck up. He crouches down and looks at her, getting choked up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, sweetie, but your brain is the size of a radish. I am a fuck up. I always have been, and I always will be. Guys like me, we know how to have fun, but we don't know how to do the important stuff, you know...? Be good, okay, kiddo? She nods, confused. He kisses her head and exits, emotion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain still pours down. Jamie, tears streaking her fac drives home in stop-and-go traffic. Then, through her sid window, we see Dave sprinting alongside her car, waving!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Not seeing him, she accelerates forward and Dave disappea from view. . .until she stops, and Dave catches up again:

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Still not seeing him, Jamie accelerates onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the stop-and-go traffic moves only slightly faster. Jamie continues quietly CRYING to herself... Then we see

dialogues.speaker: DAVE RUNNING ALONG THE SHOULDER OF THE 101
dialogues.text: in the driving rain, waving his hands and yelling!

dialogues.speaker: JESUS JAMIE
dialogues.text: Finally, she glances over, sees Dave -- and startles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch?

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE PULL OVER BEFORE I DIE
dialogues.text: Jamie, stunned, pulls onto the shoulder and stops. A seco later, Dave hops into the car, soaking wet and panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the matter with you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know I haven't been a very good husband or father recently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm done looking over the fence for something better. I've seen what's on the other side, and it's great. . .and young... and supple... but it's not you. And the truth is there will always be another fence with shinier toys on the other side, but the only way to be happy is to say fuck the fence and just appreciate what you have, you know? Find the fun with what you got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry I stopped appreciating you, pumpkin. I love you. And I love our weird little kids. And I can't believe I ever thought that wasn't enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why...are you calling me pumpkin? And then he kisses her. She resists--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch--?. But he holds her firm. And soon she's kissing him back, confused and overwhelmed and crying... It's emotional and intense for him, too. They finally separate, but remain inches apart, breathing hard.
Jamie stares into his eyes, amazed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave? Dave nods. Jamie squints, trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...how? Dave shakes his head, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...then ...Mitch was the one... with Gladys? Dave nods again. Jamie looks relieved... Then she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, so who was that hot young thing back in the apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But-we're going to need to talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, a lot. Like, a-therapy-lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely: therapy, trust falls, The Landmark Forum, Eat Pray Love, I'll do whatever the fuck you want, Jamie, I just want you back... She smiles and kisses him again. And then again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of like kissing Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I noticed. I'm not sure how I feel about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling, kissing him again) So ...mmm...so what do we do now?
Dave suddenly remembers the fountain and looks at his wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! We gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rain tapers off, Jamie rockets through LA, running lights, skidding through turns, splashing through puddles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie and Dave squeal up to their house to see Mitch, out front, sadly trying to pack a Barcalounger into his Ferra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch! Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinting inside car) Is that Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the fucking car, dipshit! Mitch, terrified, sprints to the car and hops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie races through LA at 80 mph. Dave sits shotgun, and Mitch sits in the back, wide-eyed, scared:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, um, are you guys driving me to the desert to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Jamie knows about the change- up. We're all good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It suddenly makes a lot more sense why you spent so much time rubbing my breastfeeding cream onto my boobs every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, dude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just...trying to be helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and what about that time you--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I don't want to know! Let's just hope we get to the warehouse before they ship off our fountain... Off Dave's concerned look we

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Port of Los Angeles never sleeps. Huge diesel cranes and unload freighters as tractor trailers THUNDER to and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is lined with WAREHOUSES. Beat. Then Jamie ski around the corner, Tokyo Drift-style, in her station wago

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There it is! Jamie screeches up to a warehouse labelled L.A. DEPARTMEN PARKS; she, Mitch and Dave pile out of the car and run in

dialogues.speaker: THE IMMENSE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: where they sprint down the towering aisles, past park sig swingsets, jungle gyms -- and finally, fountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Four WORKMEN pack the FOUNTAIN OF METIS into a large wood crate for transport. Jamie, Mitch and Dave run over to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Stop! The workmen stop packing the fountain, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We...We need that fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.. .need this fountain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We have to pee in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a magic fountain. The workmen just look at them, deadpan. Then Dave reaches into his wallet and starts pulling out CASH--

dialogues.speaker: MITCH AND DAVE STANDING SIDE BY SIDE AT THE FOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: with their pants down around their ankles. Dave starts PEEING. Mitch doesn't. Dave hisses at him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, open the floodgates!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't pee with them watching! PAN OVER to the workmen, standing nearby, looking at Mitc and Dave like they're total freaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I can't keep going forever! Mitch tilts his head back and quietly sings to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is shining all the time, Looks like another perfect day, I love L.A. We love it! I love L.A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you singing Randy Newman--? Then we hear a second stream of PEE hit the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, quick, we have to hug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing back at workmen) Do we, though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have to do everything exactly the same! Come on! As they scootch together and put their arms around each other, Mitch calls over to the workmen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, this isn't gay! Our penises aren't even touching--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on: "I wish I had my old life back" on three! One, two:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had my old life I wish I had my old life back! back!

dialogues.speaker: JUST THEN A THUNDER CLAP CRASHES OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The lights in the warehouse flicker. Dave and Mitch finis peeing and slowly zip up, exchanging a worried look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it worked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck should I know? (waving to workmen) Thank you! Have a pleasant evening!

dialogues.speaker: PEACEFUL BLACK STILLNESS
dialogues.text: Then we hear a baby SCREAM BLOODY MURDER. Then we hear a second baby join in, even more shrill than the first. Finally, we hear the worst two words a parent can ever he

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: Dave turns on the light, rushes over to the mirror, and touches his face, overjoyed, clearly back in the right bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank God. Thank God. Pumpkin, it worked! I'm back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy, half-asleep) Great, go feed the fucking babies. She rolls over and goes back to sleep. He grins and runs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave cheerfully sings as he changes Sarah's diaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just vomited on my hand but I love yooooou...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave bounces down the hallway, a twin in each arm, SCREAM into each of his ears and taking turns kicking his balls. and he's grinning. In fact, he couldn't look happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch slowly wakes up in his empty apartment. He stares a the blank walls, a little bummed... Then he startles when SABRINA rolls over, looking ravishi

dialogues.text: Last night was weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... are you ever going to have sex with me?

dialogues.text: Yes. Yes I am.

dialogues.text: Jamie is cleaning up the toys in the living room -- when nuzzles up to her from behind, seductive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twins are down for their nap, Cara is watching The Backyardigans... Jamie raises her eyebrow, oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Tuesday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Tuesday morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, mornings, late night, I'm like Denny's, baby, I'm open 24-7. She laughs, and he scoops her up and heads upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun sets over LA. The MUSIC in the air and the cars lining the street tell us that Dave is hosting a party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "CONGRATS ON GETTING A JOB, MITCH!" banner hangs from t swingset. Kids race about as adults drink, eat, and mingl Dave, in jeans and a tee shirt, works the barbecue and ta to Mitch, in a jacket and tie, as he adjusts his crotch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't get used to the whole underwear thing. It's such a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugar-bug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my favorite ballerina?!
Cara turns, takes Mitch's hand, and flips him onto his ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a ballerina anymore, bitch. She races off. Mitch painfully pulls himself to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fucking Christ... Dave sees SABRINA, looking angelic in a sundress, chattin with a circle of GUESTS on the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. How's it going with Sabrina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Good for you. Mitch nods, proud, I know. Swigs his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she's fucking Fernando Valenzuela? We see that the man she's talking to is, in fact, Dodger great FERNANDO VALENZUELA, in a pimped-out white suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm oddly okay with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe they're family friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. She really is perfect-- Just then TATIANA and KIEFER SUTHERLAND approach, wheelin her newborn DAUGHTER in a pram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go feed her baby, but congrats on your new gig, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Kiefer. See you guys. Mitch kisses Tatiana on the cheek and they head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's creepy that Kiefer Sutherland is like way into other people's babies, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Dave flips the burgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again for hooking me up with the job at Amalgamated, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the CEO owed me a favor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm really going to crush it in corporate America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so too. Just then, MITCH'S DAD approaches. MITCH, SR. I'm heading out. Thanks for having me. Mitch, Sr. pulls his son into an emotional hug.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Dad. They break apart. Mitch, Sr. heads off. Then he stops. Tu MITCH, SR. Hey Mitch... Mitch turns.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, SR., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm real proud of you.
Mitch nods, trying not to show how much this means to him Mitch, Sr., heads off. Mitch and Dave stand side by side, reflective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it weird that I miss your penis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. SMASH TO BLACK.
